# Discord Chat Analysis for ðŸ§Šâ”‚3d-design Channel

## 1. Summary
The discussion focused on texture optimization techniques for 3D models, particularly comparing PNG and WebP formats. Vox shared findings that 512x512 PNG textures can provide better quality than 2048x2048 WebP textures while using less VRAM. The conversation highlighted that WebP is excellent for most PBR textures and transparent elements, but performs poorly with gradient-heavy baked textures. Vox recommended using 100% WebP by default and only switching to other formats when quality issues arise. The chat also covered denoising techniques, with Vox mentioning they skip denoising algorithms during baking and apply denoising via compositing later for better results. Finally, Vox shared a PBR atlas they created - a single texture that can be used to build entire scenes with minimal draw calls by joining or instancing meshes, featuring different roughness values and emissions in one texture.

## 2. FAQ
Q: What compression level is the webp though? (asked by Ashxn) A: Vox didn't specify the exact compression level but mentioned that compression hurts most with gradient elements like baking (answered by vox)
